title: Spread Strategies
description: Explore bull and bear spreads, which are options strategies that limit both risk and reward for more controlled trading.
introduction: Spread strategies involve simultaneously buying and selling options to create a position with limited risk and limited reward. They're excellent for traders who want more control over their risk exposure.

bullSpread.title: Bull Spread (Call Spread)
bullSpread.description: A bullish strategy that profits when the underlying asset rises in price.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.p1: Buy a call option at a lower strike price and simultaneously sell a call option at a higher strike price.
howItWorks.p2: Both options have the same expiration date.

profitLoss.title: Profit and Loss
profitLoss.maxProfit: Maximum profit = Difference between strike prices - Net premium paid
profitLoss.breakeven: Breakeven point = Lower strike price + Net premium paid

bullSpread.whenToUse: Use when you're moderately bullish on a stock and want to limit your risk

bearSpread.title: Bear Spread (Put Spread)
bearSpread.description: A bearish strategy that profits when the underlying asset falls in price.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.p1: Buy a put option at a higher strike price and simultaneously sell a put option at a lower strike price.
howItWorks.p2: Both options have the same expiration date.

profitLoss.title: Profit and Loss
profitLoss.maxProfit: Maximum profit = Difference between strike prices - Net premium paid
profitLoss.breakeven: Breakeven point = Higher strike price - Net premium paid

bearSpread.whenToUse: Use when you're moderately bearish on a stock and want to limit your risk

advantages.title: Advantages of Spread Strategies
advantages.lowerCost: Lower cost than buying options outright

disadvantages.title: Disadvantages of Spread Strategies
disadvantages.limitedUpside: Limited profit potential compared to buying options outright
disadvantages.complexity: More complex than simple long or short positions
disadvantages.commissions: Higher transaction costs due to multiple option trades

keyTakeaways.title: Key Takeaways
keyTakeaways.takeaway1: Spread strategies limit both risk and reward for more controlled trading.
keyTakeaways.takeaway2: Bull spreads profit when the underlying asset rises; bear spreads profit when it falls.
keyTakeaways.takeaway3: Maximum risk is limited to the net premium paid.
keyTakeaways.takeaway4: These strategies are excellent for traders who want defined risk exposure.
